title: Blended Photography Education Curriculum for Integrating Visual Arts Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic camera operation skills and photography experience
context.additional_context: Integrated theoretical visual literacy and practical photography skills via hybrid online-offline classes using digital devices, culminating in project-based implementation

learning_goals: Learners will select at least three visual media types (academic papers, infographics, advertisements), analyze their visual elements (color, layout, symbols), and write a 500-word interpretation report. They must achieve an 80% or higher satisfaction rate in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

Learners will use online collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Jamboard) to incorporate feedback from peers at least three times, create a project portfolio with 10+ photos, and achieve a score of 4 or higher (out of 5) on the peer evaluation rubric (creativity, technical completeness, feedback incorporation).

Learners will produce one 3-minute creative video content applying linguistic theories (discourse analysis, pragmatics) in at least three practical filming sessions. They must achieve a total score of 80+ based on peer and instructor evaluation criteria (30% creativity, 40% theoretical applicability, 30% technical completeness).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
